meanings.sent1: The imprecision of his measurements made it hard to determine the correct length.
meanings.sent2: The imprecision in her speech caused confusion among the listeners.
meanings.sent3: The imprecision in the recipe led to a cake that tasted like soap.
meanings.sent4: His imprecision in following the map resulted in getting lost in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The imprecision of the artist's brushstrokes gave the painting a dream-like quality.

meanings.sent1: The imprecision of the design made it difficult to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent2: Her writing had an air of imprecision that made it hard to understand her point.
meanings.sent3: The imprecision of the clock made it seem like time was moving backwards.
meanings.sent4: The imprecision of his memory made it challenging to recall important details.
meanings.sent5: The imprecision of the instructions caused confusion among the students.
